title: Watch Choir! Choir! Choir!'s powerful performance with Patti Smith and Stewart Copeland | CBC Music
text:
Back in April, Toronto singing group Choir! Choir! Choir! travelled to New York City to perform at the Onassis Festival 2019: Democracy is Coming, accompanied by 250 attendees and two very special guests: Patti Smith and the Police's Stewart Copeland. Now, a video of that performance has been released.

Led by Nobu Adilman and Daveed Goldman, everyone sang Smith's 1988 anthem, "People Have the Power." Smith provided vocals and played a "Brazilian samba frying pan," according to Choir! Choir! Choir! "Don't forget it, use your voice," Smith exclaims, at the end of the performance.

"What happened was pure magic and we're still pinching ourselves," the group wrote on its YouTube channel.

Next month, Choir! Choir! Choir! will head even further south, to the U.S./Mexico border to perform the Beatles' "With a Little Help From my Friends" with singers in San Diego and Tijuana.
description: Together, they performed 'People Have the Power' in New York City.
